jobs.title: Operations Associate
description: Program managed the lifecycle of new class content and curriculum, implementing new classes on the consumer-facing Studio website using VS Code and ensuring cross-functional teams were aligned on deliverables throughout the process.
Executed class launches, company rebranding, and new product initiatives with multiple engineering teams, the curriculum team, the marketing team, and the post-production team.

Managed a freelance Quality Assurance associate. Conducted the hiring process, created software walkthrough documentation, used technical judgment for bug triage, and escalated issues to Engineering as needed.

jobs.title: Operations Specialist
description: Program managed the e-learning tool used across YouTube Spaces globally, maintaining content and user processes.
Managed a global group of 20+ subject matter experts to identify work problems and goals for Google’s event, e-learning, and finance tools.

Led bi-weekly bug review and quarterly prioritization of feature requests and bugs, working with engineers to resolve tickets and improve user experiences for users at all YouTube Spaces. Conducted UAT for engineers as necessary.
Developed documentation for user roadmaps, tools training, FAQs, SOPs, onboarding, and institutional knowledge.

jobs.title: Events Specialist (Data Analyst)
description: Executed multiple processes and workflows for approx. 10 - 15 events per month at YouTube Space LA.
Trained team on internal tools and processes, product updates, and security procedures to protect attendee data.
Analyzed data, maintained data integrity, led data clean-up initiatives, and leveraged analytic insights to improve events.

jobs.title: Volunteer Program Manager
description: Orchestrated the volunteer program for this social impact conference, spearheaded communications, training sessions, and placements for 30+ volunteers.
Supervised multiple workflows and check-in stations for 200+ attendees, speakers, and press.
Project managed on-site operations of volunteers and vendors.

technical-projects.title: WeAte.
technical-projects.one-liner: A dinner party planner built with React + styled with CSS.
description: Implemented authentication and authorization to allow users to create individual accounts and access information.
Wrote API functionality with Ruby on Rails, built the database schema, and used ActiveRecord + SQLite for DB logic.
Incorporated Email.js to allow users to send themselves guest and ingredient lists for party planning.

technical-projects.title: Groovehound
technical-projects.one-liner: An app to track previous concert attendance and find upcoming concerts.
description: Implemented backend API with Ruby on Rails, using ActiveRecord and MVC framework to set up relationships.
Created login functionality with authentication and authorization
Used a combination of Mantine framework and CSS for UI, creating an eye-catching profile page and band cards.
commentary: First time using auth and auth

technical-projects.title: Tutoring Scheduler
technical-projects.one-liner: Created an app for students to schedule time with tutors using React and Ruby.
description: Implemented CRUD functionality on appointment scheduling and creation.
Added styling to support a strong visual identity – used CSS and an imported font to make app look like a handwritten notebook page.
Mapped through backend seed data, generating cards for every instance of appointments, students, and instructors.

technical-projects.title: Book Deserts
technical-projects.one-liner: A resource for sharing information about book deserts and organizations that are working to change them.
description: Used React, CSS for styling, and implemented NavLink, ensuring site was compelling and easy to navigate.
Created a RESTful API for the backend, organizing book and resource information so it was easily accessible.
commentary: Use coding to share resources and ideas

technical-projects.title: Farmers Market Recipe Finder
technical-projects.one-liner: A resource for finding recipes inspired by seasonal items from the farmers market.
description: Used onClick
CSS for styling
commentary: I love farmers markets and cooking
Eager to upgrade with better seasonal logic
